newsitem.title: JAPAN: N.Korean paper says no one starving after floods.
newsitem.headline: N.Korean paper says no one starving after floods.

text.p: A North Korean newspaper has reported that many people lost homes and property as a result of recent devastating floods, but no one was starving as a result.
"In the areas stricken by the unprecedented floods, many residents lost all of their homes and properties," said the August 27 edition of the North Korean government newspaper Minju Joson.
"But there is no one bewildered with nothing to wear under the cold skies or starving," the official daily, received by the Tokyo-based Radiopress news agency on Wednesday, said.
Pyongyang's official media have said floods in July seriously damaged vast areas in the communist state, caused many deaths, and made many people homeless.
North Korea was already widely reported to be on the brink of famine after the worst floods in a century ravaged much of the country last year, wiping out most of the 1995 rice harvest.
"There are not a few people who lost their properties. But no matter what area you visit, you see people full of conviction and optimism as usual," the newspaper said.
Japanese aid workers, who recently visited the reclusive state, said the latest floods directly hit a southern rice growing area and caused more serious damage to food output than last year's floods.
